actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 102-473.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 281.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendments by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-275.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act by designating certain rivers in the State of Arkansas as components of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.
short_title: Arkansas Wild and Scenic Rivers Act of 1992

summary.text: Arkansas Wild and Scenic Rivers Act of 1992 - Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate certain river segments in Arkansas as components of the Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Requires the State to manage other designated river segments as part of such system. Declares that nothing in this Act is intended to prohibit the Secretary of the Army from: (1) operating Gillham Lake, including lake levels and releases, in a manner consistent with the Gillham project; or (2) establishing a public use area for float trip termination at the confluence of the Cossatot River with Gillham Lake.
